## Introduction

```{python}
import plotly.graph_objects as go

# Define the locations and names of the stock exchanges
stock_exchanges = {
    'New York': {'lat': 40.7128, 'lon': -74.0060, 'info': 'Placeholder for NY statistics'},
    'London': {'lat': 51.5074, 'lon': -0.1278, 'info': 'Placeholder for London statistics'},
    'Hong Kong': {'lat': 22.3193, 'lon': 114.1694, 'info': 'Placeholder for Hong Kong statistics'},
    'Tokyo': {'lat': 35.6895, 'lon': 139.6917, 'info': 'Placeholder for Tokyo statistics'},
    # Add other major stock exchanges as needed
}

# Create a list of the data for plotting
data = []
for city, values in stock_exchanges.items():
    data.append(
        go.Scattergeo(
            lon=[values['lon']],
            lat=[values['lat']],
            text=[f"{city}: {values['info']}"],
            marker=dict(
                size=10,
                color='red',
                line_color='black',
                line_width=0.5,
                sizemode='area'
            ),
            name=f"{city} Stock Exchange"
        )
    )

# Define the layout of the map
layout = go.Layout(
    title=dict(text='Global Financial Market Importance', x=0.5),
    geo=dict(
        resolution=50,
        scope='world',
        showframe=False,
        showcoastlines=True,
        landcolor='rgb(217, 217, 217)',
        countrycolor='rgb(204, 204, 204)',
    ),
    annotations=[
        dict(
            x=0,
            y=0.1,
            xref='paper',
            yref='paper',
            text='Trust and Integrity in Markets - Placeholder for global impact statistics',
            showarrow=False
        )
    ]
)

# Create the figure with data and layout
fig = go.Figure(data=data, layout=layout)

# Show the figure
fig.show()

```
